text:
I'm trying to use Apache 1.3.24 with Cygwin 1.3.10(0.51/3/2) on NT4 SP6 
(version number reported by Windows: 4.00.1381), using the precompiled binaries 
that come with the Cygwin distribution. 

When I start the server using 'apachectl start', the following message is sent 
to the logs and stderr:

C:\cygwin\usr\sbin\httpd.exe: *** recreate_mmaps_after_fork_failed
    812 [main] httpd 294 fixup_mmaps_after_fork: base address fails to match req
uested address 0x930000.

The server never becomes available to service requests, but I can normally shut 
it down using 'apachectl stop'.

I also tried the binary package downloadable from at 
http://apache.dev.wapme.net, as instructed in 
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/cygwin.html. I didn't work either, with similar 
results.
creator: fernando_cuenca@yahoo.com.ar

text:
Sorry, this is nothing but a broken implementation of fork().  Try a later
  build of cygwin, but please don't reopen this report as it has nothing
  to do with the Apache software.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
